org.joty.workstation.data

Class WResultSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.joty.data.WrappedResultSet
      • org.joty.workstation.data.WResultSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.joty.data.JotyResultSet

    public class WResultSet
extends org.joty.data.WrappedResultSet
    This descendant of WrappedResultSet participates in the implementation of the duality of the running mode of the Joty application for workstation.

    It is typical to have, indeed, methods that show either an ordinary processing on a wrapped java.sql.ResultSet object or the invocation of the web client instance, in order to communicate with the Joty Server and to get data or returned codes from it, as response to inquiries or sql commands, respectively.

    The open and the next methods are examples of how the m_cursor member is populated from two different possible sources.

    In the case of direct access to the jdbc layer the primitives of it are used.

    The class supports the Accessor mode also and takes the suited action after having detected it on the invoking environment.

    See Also:
    Accessor, WebClient
